goal.ch:
Welcome to IM5023, a research-based course focusing on Digital Brand Management with direct relevance to the world of digital marketing (branding). This course is meticulously designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the subject matter through a curated selection of readings encompassing theoretical papers, empirical studies, and reviews. Drawing from an extensive array of journal articles, both classic and contemporary, this course aims to offer a representative sample of the ongoing research within the field. 
Throughout this course, class sessions will primarily center around in-depth discussions of the assigned readings for each week. It is expected that students come prepared having thoroughly engaged with the materials beforehand. To facilitate meaningful discussions, students are encouraged to not only read the articles but also to make personal notes on points of interest, areas of confusion, and agreements or disagreements with the readings. This practice will serve to enrich our collective understanding of the topic and foster deeper insights into digital brand management strategies. By actively participating in these discussions and engaging critically with the course materials, students will acquire the knowledge and analytical skills necessary to navigate the complex landscape of digital brand management in contemporary business environments.
goal.en:
Welcome to IM5023, a research-based course focusing on Digital Brand Management with direct relevance to the world of digital marketing (branding). This course is meticulously designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the subject matter through a curated selection of readings encompassing theoretical papers, empirical studies, and reviews. Drawing from an extensive array of journal articles, both classic and contemporary, this course aims to offer a representative sample of the ongoing research within the field. 
Throughout this course, class sessions will primarily center around in-depth discussions of the assigned readings for each week. It is expected that students come prepared having thoroughly engaged with the materials beforehand. To facilitate meaningful discussions, students are encouraged to not only read the articles but also to make personal notes on points of interest, areas of confusion, and agreements or disagreements with the readings. This practice will serve to enrich our collective understanding of the topic and foster deeper insights into digital brand management strategies. By actively participating in these discussions and engaging critically with the course materials, students will acquire the knowledge and analytical skills necessary to navigate the complex landscape of digital brand management in contemporary business environments.

outline.ch:
WeekDateTopics Covered
12024/02/19Course Introduction
22024/02/26Customer journey
Paper Discussion (1): Lemon, K. N., ＆ Verhoef, P. C. (2016). Understanding customer experience throughout the customer journey. Journal of Marketing, 80(6), 69-96.
Paper Discussion (2): Schweidel, D. A., Bart, Y., Inman, J. J., Stephen, A. T., Libai, B., Andrews, M., ... ＆ Thomaz, F. (2022). How consumer digital signals are reshaping the customer journey. Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 1-20.
Paper Discussion (3): Pizzutti, C., Gonçalves, R., ＆ Ferreira, M. (2022). Information search behavior at the post-purchase stage of the customer journey. Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 50(5), 981-1010.
32024/03/04Customer (brand) experience
Paper Discussion (4): Becker, L., ＆ Jaakkola, E. (2020). Customer experience: fundamental premises and implications for research. Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 48(4), 630-648.
Paper Discussion (5): Hagtvedt, H. (2022). A brand (new) experience: art, aesthetics, and sensory effects. Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 50(3), 425-428.
Paper Discussion (6): Yu, X., Yuan, C., Kim, J., ＆ Wang, S. (2020). A new form of brand experience in online social networks: An empirical analysis. Journal of Business Research.
Reference (1): Brakus, J. J., Schmitt, B. H., ＆ Zarantonello, L. (2009). Brand experience: what is it? How is it measured? Does it affect loyalty?. Journal of Marketing, 73(3), 52-6
42024/03/11Digital experience
Paper Discussion (7): Hoyer, W. D., Kroschke, M., Schmitt, B., Kraume, K., ＆ Shankar, V. (2020). Transforming the customer experience through new technologies. Journal of Interactive Marketing, 51, 57-71.
Paper Discussion (8): Plangger, K., Grewal, D., de Ruyter, K., ＆ Tucker, C. (2022). The future of digital technologies in marketing: A conceptual framework and an overview. Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 1-10.
Paper Discussion (9): Flavián, C., Ibáñez-Sánchez, S., ＆ Orús, C. (2019). The impact of virtual, augmented and mixed reality technologies on the customer experience. Journal of Business Research, 100, 547-560.
Paper Discussion (10): Kozinets, R. V. (2023). Immersive netnography: a novel method for service experience research in virtual reality, augmented reality and metaverse contexts. Journal of Service Management, 34(1), 100-125.
Reference (2): Trunfio, M., Jung, T., ＆ Campana, S. (2022). Mixed reality experiences in museums: Exploring the impact of functional elements of the devices on visitors’ immersive experiences and post-experience behaviours. Information ＆ Management, 59(8), 103698.
52024/03/18The basics of branding
Paper Discussion (11): Black, I., ＆ Veloutsou, C. (2017). Working consumers: Co-creation of brand identity, consumer identity and brand community identity. Journal of Business Research, 70, 416-429.
Paper Discussion (12): Tran, T. P., Mai, E. S., ＆ Taylor, E. C. (2021). Enhancing brand equity of branded mobile apps via motivations: A service-dominant logic perspective. Journal of Business Research, 125, 239-251.
Paper Discussion (13): Malär, L., Krohmer, H., Hoyer, W. D., ＆ Nyffenegger, B. (2011). Emotional brand attachment and brand personality: The relative importance of the actual and the ideal self. Journal of Marketing, 75(4), 35-52.
Reference (3): Keller, K. L. (1993). Conceptualizing, measuring, and managing customer-based brand equity. Journal of Marketing, 57(1), 1-22.
62024/03/25Digital service encounters
Paper Discussion (14): Bolton, R. N., Gustafsson, A., Tarasi, C. O., ＆ Witell, L. (2022). Designing satisfying service encounters: website versus store touchpoints. Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 1-23.
Paper Discussion (15): Ahearne, M., Atefi, Y., Lam, S. K., ＆ Pourmasoudi, M. (2022). The future of buyer–seller interactions: a conceptual framework and research agenda. Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 1-24.
Paper Discussion (16): Li, X., Chan, K. W., ＆ Kim, S. (2019). Service with emoticons: How customers interpret employee use of emoticons in online service encounters. Journal of Consumer Research, 45(5), 973-987.
72024/04/01Social commerce
Paper Discussion (17): Chen, X., Liu, Z., Wei, S., ＆ Liu, Y. (2021). Understanding the role of affordances in promoting social commerce engagement. International Journal of Electronic Commerce, 25(3), 287-312.
Paper Discussion (18): Jin, X. L., Chen, X., ＆ Zhou, Z. (2022). The impact of cover image authenticity and aesthetics on users’ product-knowing and content-reading willingness in social shopping community. International Journal of Information Management, 62, 102428.
Paper Discussion (19): Bawack, R. E., Bonhoure, E., Kamdjoug, J. R. K., ＆ Giannakis, M. (2023). How social media live streams affect online buyers: A uses and gratifications perspective. International Journal of Information Management, 70, 102621.
82024/04/08Midterm Proposal (Date to be announced)
92024/04/15Online (social media) communities
Paper Discussion (23): Mousavi, S., ＆ Roper, S. (2023). Enhancing Relationships Through Online Brand Communities: Comparing Posters and Lurkers. International Journal of Electronic Commerce, 27(1), 66-99.
Paper Discussion (24): James, T. L., Calderon, E. D. V., Bélanger, F., ＆ Lowry, P. B. (2022). The mediating role of group dynamics in shaping received social support from active and passive use in online health communities. Information ＆ Management, 59(3), 103606.
Paper Discussion (25): Giertz, J. N., Weiger, W. H., Törhönen, M., ＆ Hamari, J. (2022). Content versus community focus in live streaming services: how to drive engagement in synchronous social media. Journal of Service Management, 33(1), 33-58.
102024/04/22User-generated (vs. firm-generated) content
Paper Discussion (29): Hernández-Ortega, B. I., Stanko, M. A., Rishika, R., Molina-Castillo, F. J., ＆ Franco, J. (2022). Brand-generated social media content and its differential impact on loyalty program members. Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 50(5), 1071-1090.
Paper Discussion (30): Shen, R. P., Liu, D., Wei, X., ＆ Zhang, M. (2022). Your posts betray you: Detecting influencer-generated sponsored posts by finding the right clues. Information ＆ Management, 59(8), 103719.
Paper Discussion (31): Zhang, Y., Hua, L., Jiao, Y., Zhang, J., ＆ Saini, R. (2023). More than Watching: An Empirical and Experimental Examination on the Impacts of Live Streaming User-Generated Video Consumption. Information ＆ Management, 103771.
112024/04/29Social influencer
Paper Discussion (26): Leung, F. F., Gu, F. F., ＆ Palmatier, R. W. (2022). Online influencer marketing. Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 1-26.
Paper Discussion (27): Wu, Y., Nambisan, S., Xiao, J., ＆ Xie, K. (2022). Consumer resource integration and service innovation in social commerce: the role of social media influencers. Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 50(3), 429-459.
Paper Discussion (28): Chen, L., Yan, Y., ＆ Smith, A. N. (2022). What drives digital engagement with sponsored videos? An investigation of video influencers’ authenticity management strategies. Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 1-24.
122024/05/06Crowdfunding
Paper Discussion (32): Banerjee, S., ＆ Bose, I. (2022). An attractive proposition? Persuading retail consumers to prefer reward-based crowdfunding for owning upcoming technologies. Information ＆ Management, 59(6), 103663.
Paper Discussion (33): Liu, X., Fang, Y., ＆ Ye, Q. (2022). Product sampling on reward-based crowdfunding platforms. Information ＆ Management, 59(8), 103718.
Paper Discussion (34): Allison, T. H., Warnick, B. J., Davis, B. C., ＆ Cardon, M. S. (2022). Can you hear me now? Engendering passion and preparedness perceptions with vocal expressions in crowdfunding pitches. Journal of Business Venturing, 37(3), 106193.
132024/05/13AI-enabled services
Paper Discussion (20): Kumar, P., Sharma, S. K., ＆ Dutot, V. (2023). Artificial intelligence (AI)-enabled CRM capability in healthcare: The impact on service innovation. International Journal of Information Management, 69, 102598.
Paper Discussion (21): Longoni, C., ＆ Cian, L. (2022). Artificial intelligence in utilitarian vs. hedonic contexts: The “word-of-machine” effect. Journal of Marketing, 86(1), 91-108.
Paper Discussion (22): Liu-Thompkins, Y., Okazaki, S., ＆ Li, H. (2022). Artificial empathy in marketing interactions: Bridging the human-AI gap in affective and social customer experience. Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 50(6), 1198-1218.
142024/05/20Sustainability
Paper Discussion (35): Hur, W. M., Kim, H., ＆ Woo, J. (2014). How CSR leads to corporate brand equity: Mediating mechanisms of corporate brand credibility and reputation. Journal of Business Ethics, 125(1), 75-86.
Paper Discussion (36): Luan, J., Filieri, R., Xiao, J., Han, Q., Zhu, B., ＆ Wang, T. (2023). Product information and green consumption: An integrated perspective of regulatory focus, self-construal, and temporal distance. Information ＆ Management, 60(2), 103746.
Paper Discussion (37): Nickerson, D., Lowe, M., Pattabhiramaiah, A., ＆ Sorescu, A. (2022). The impact of corporate social responsibility on brand sales: An accountability perspective. Journal of Marketing, 86(2), 5-28.
152024/05/27Personal Term Paper Presentation
162024/06/03Personal Term Paper Presentation
172024/06/10Dragon Boat Festival (No Class)
182024/06/17To be determined

textbook.ch: Keller, K.L. and Swaminathan, V. (2019) Strategic Brand Management: Building, Measuring, and Managing Brand Equity (5th Edition).
textbook.en: Keller, K.L. and Swaminathan, V. (2019) Strategic Brand Management: Building, Measuring, and Managing Brand Equity (5th Edition).

gradMethod.ch:
Academic Paper Review/Presentation/Discussion (40％)
Midterm Proposal (20％)
Personal Term Paper (40％)
gradMethod.en:
Academic Paper Review/Presentation/Discussion (40％)
Midterm Proposal (20％)
Personal Term Paper (40％)

domain.ch:
商管知識


、


電子商務管理
domain.en:
商管知識


、


電子商務管理

ch.competencies: 獨立思考和解決問題能力

ch: 學制:限碩士班、博士班。系所:限資訊管理學系碩士班、資訊管理學系博士班。
en: Type:Master's Program、Doctoral Program only.Department:Master of Information Management、PhD in Information Management only.
